doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF THIS CONTRACT SHALL UPGRADE THE EARLY WARNING RADAR (EWR) AT CLEAR AIR FORCE STATION (AFS), ALASKA, WITH AN OPTION FOR CAPE COD AFS, MASSACHUSETTS (HEREIN REFERRED TO AS THE CLEAR UPGRADE AND CAPE COD UPGRADE RESPECTIVELY). UNDER THIS CONTRACT THE SIGNAL PROCESSORS (SP) AND DATA PROCESSORS (DP) AT BEALE AIR FORCE BASE (AFB), CALIFORNIA SHALL BE REHOSTED YIELDING A CLEAN AND STABLE BASELINE FOR THE CLEAR UPGRADE (AND THE CAPE COD UPGRADE IF CONTRACT OPTION IS EXERCISED). THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE CLEAR AND CAPE COD UPGRADES IS TO ADD A MISSILE DEFENSE CAPABILITY TO THE EXISTING MISSILE WARNING AND SPACE SURVEILLANCE MISSIONS, WHILE MAINTAINING THE ON-GOING OPERATIONAL MISSION. ADDITIONALLY RAF FYLINGDALES SHALL BE UPDATED WITH A NEW DP/SP SUITE REPRESENTING THE SAME REHOSTED DESIGN AT BEALE, CLEAR AND CAPE COD. EACH DP/SP SUITE INCLUDES, AS A MINIMUM, THE DP, SP, DISPLAY AND CONTROLS PROCESSOR (DCP), EXTERNAL COMMUNICATION PROCESSOR (ECP), SIMULATOR TESTER (ST), ST ELECTRONICS CABINET (EC) AND ALLIED PERIPHERALS TO RESOLVE OBSOLESCENCE ISSUES WITH EXITING FUNCTIONALITY. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR WORKING WITH THE MISSILE DEFENSE AGENCY (MDA) BALLISTIC MISSILE DEFENSE SYSTEM (BMDS) INTEGRATION/COMMUNICATION CONTRACTORS TO ESTABLISH CONNECTIVITY FROM THE RADAR TO THE GROUND-BASED MIDCOURSE DEFENSE (GMD) FIRE CONTROL AND COMMUNICATION (GFCC). THE CLEAR UPGRADE SHALL BE DESIGNED BASED ON REVISION G OF THE PRIME ITEM DEVELOPMENT SPECIFICATION (PIDS) AND THIS SOW. ALTHOUGH NOT REQUIRED UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THIS CONTRACT TO FULLY IMPLEMENT THE REQUIREMENTS OF PIDS REV H AND THE BMD SYSTEM SPECIFICATION (SS), THE DESIGN SHALL BE MODULAR, SCALABLE, FLEXIBLE, AND ROBUST ENOUGH TO BE ABLE TO ADDRESS THESE ADDITIONAL AND FUTURE EMERGING REQUIREMENTS WITHOUT SIGNIFICANT ARCHITECTURE MODIFICATIONS. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN AN OPEN ARCHITECTURE THAT IS: RECONFIGURABLE, PORTABLE, MAINTAINABLE, CAPABLE OF TECHNOLOGY INSERTION, VENDOR- INDEPENDENT, REUSABLE, SCALABLE, INTEROPERABLE, UPGRADEABLE, AND LONG-TERM SUPPORTABLE. THE CONTRACTOR MODULAR DESIGN AND INTEGRATION SHALL MAXIMIZE THE USE OF COMMERCIAL-OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) COMPONENT/ INTERFACE STANDARDS, TECHNOLOGIES, PRODUCTS, OR ARCHITECTURES WHILE ENSURING LOGISTICAL SUPPORTABILITY THROUGHOUT THE LIFE CYCLE.
